description: PSPC on behalf of PSPC is inviting bidders for the purchase, delivery, installation, and maintenance training for the eight (8) remaining air mobile containers for the Department of National Defence (DND).
full_summary:
[collapse markdown]
# Government Tender Announcement: RFP Air-Mobile Containers

### Advertisement

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC), on behalf of the Department of National Defence (DND), issues this Request for Proposal (RFP) solicitation for the purchase, delivery, installation, and maintenance training of ten (10) air-mobile containers at the Canadian Forces Base (CFB) Bagotville, Alouette, Quebec, Canada.

### Background

This bid solicitation cancels and supersedes previous solicitation number W0138-21A066, dated 28 December 2021, with a closing date of 24 March 2022 at 2pm EST. Interested suppliers are hereby invited to submit proposals for this new RFP.

### Bidder Requirements

* The tendered goods and services must meet the technical specifications outlined in Section 3 of the solicitation.
* Vendors must demonstrate sufficient experience and expertise in delivering air-mobile containers.
* Bids must be submitted electronically through the Ariba Discovery platform.
* All bidders must meet the requirements outlined in the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) and the World Trade Organization (WTO) Agreement on Government Procurement.

### Technical Specifications

* The scope of work includes:
	+ Purchase of ten (10) air-mobile containers
	+ Delivery and installation of the containers at CFB Bagotville
	+ Conducting maintenance training for the containers
* The containers must meet the following standards:
	+ ISO 668:2013 standard
	+ ASTM A740 standard

### Tender Evaluation Criteria

* Lowest Price will be the primary evaluation criterion.

### Contact Information

For more information about this RFP, please contact:

Gatineau, Quebec K1A 0S5

### Important Dates

* **Tender Closing Date:** 17 July 2023, 2:00pm EST
* **Expected Contract Start Date:** 1 September 2023
* **Expected Contract End Date:** 30 June 2022 (Note: This appears to be an error in the original text; the end date of the contract is likely intended to be 30 Jun
